messages.title: My Priorities for Warwick and Leamington
messages.content: TIME TO FOCUS ON YOUR PRIORITIES: Whether you voted leave or remain, more pointless delay is the last thing we need. I will support the Prime Minister’s deal – it’s time to move on and focus on our NHS, the environment, schools funding, and tackling violent crime.
FAIR FUNDING FOR OUR SCHOOLS: We are levelling up school funding to give every child the best opportunities, increasing primary school funding by 6.4% to £4,091 per pupil in Warwick and Leamington.

A GREENER AND CLEANER SOCIETY: We need to go carbon neutral - not just for our planet, but for our health and wealth too. We’re locally tackling air pollution by going electric and investing in walking and cycling routes, whilst nationally leading the world in building a green energy system for future generations.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: TIME TO FOCUS ON YOUR PRIORITIES
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Whether you voted leave or remain, more pointless delay is the last thing we need. I will support the Prime Minister’s deal – it’s time to move on and focus on our NHS, the environment, schools funding, and tackling violent crime.
We are levelling up school funding to give every child the best opportunities, increasing primary school funding by 6.4% to £4,091 per pupil in Warwick and Leamington.

We need to go carbon neutral - not just for our planet, but for our health and wealth too. We’re locally tackling air pollution by going electric and investing in walking and cycling routes, whilst nationally leading the world in building a green energy system for future generations.

mentions.tacticalSituation: John Curtice: Polls teeter between hung parliament and slim Tory majority; The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty; SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence vote; Corbyn would have to be propped up by the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.

We’re locally tackling air pollution by going electric and investing in walking and cycling routes.

increasing primary school funding by 6.4% to £4,091 per pupil in Warwick and Leamington.
I will support the Prime Minister’s deal – it’s time to move on.
I will support the Prime Minister’s deal – it’s time to move on and focus on our NHS, the environment, schools funding, and tackling violent crime.
The Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with the Conservatives. So a hung parliament means Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister. With five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
Corbyn would have to be propped up by the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain.
Don’t risk five long years of Corbyn in charge.
Jo Swinson says no to second Tory alliance.
